results.title: The Crucible
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Robert Miller, David V. Picker and Nicholas Hytner
results.brief_description: She afflicts me! She comes to me at night and torments me! She’s a witch! In the Puritan village of Salem Massachusetts in 1692, these words provoked fear and terror in the hearts of the townspeople. Behind these accusations lie the covenance of a neighbours land and a girl who will stop at nothing to capture the heart of a married man. This screenplay is penned by Arthur Miller and based on his play of the same name. He skillfully recreates a real-life story, combining intrigue, romance and suspense of the infamous Salem Witch Trials. Cast includes Daniel Day-Lewis, Winona Ryder, Paul Scofield, Joan Allen, Bruce Davidson, Rob Campbell and Jeffrey Jones. A study guide accompanies this tape.

results.title: The Crown of Thorns Story
results.creator_credit: Educational Information Service Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Authority and L Zann
results.brief_description: This video presents the most up to date report on the Crown of Thorns available in Australia today. The documentary tells the story of the Crown of Thorns on the Great barrier Reef. It traces the history of the infestations and what is now known about the starfish with special emphasis on the research currently underway.

results.title: The Crow: salvation
results.creator_credit: IMF (DE), IMF Internationale Medien und Film GmbH & Co. Produktions KG, Edward Pressman, Jeff Most and Bharat Nalluri
results.brief_description: Executed on his 21st birthday, Alex Corvis (Eric Mabius) proclaimed his innocence until the end and attributed the horrific murder of his girlfriend to a mystery man with a distinctively scarred arm. Now dead, the former prisoner is brought back to life by a crow who leads Alex to salvation, revenge and justice. Along the way he also gets to save the virtue of several young women imperilled by a corrupt posse of police and investigates a conspiracy theory involving his murdered girlfriend. Thanks to some carefully applied face paint, Alex is unrecogniseable to all who knew him, although don’t expect any great scenes of transformation as Alex is content to stay in his prison garb. Moving from one brutal encounter to another, Alex eventually discovers the real killer leaving a body count and bloody trail behind him. Relentlessly and gratuitously violent, this is the third instalment in the million dollar Crow franchise that hit the big screen in 1994, directed by Alex Proyas and starring Brandon Lee in his ill fated last screen performance. Cast also includes William Atherton, Grant Shaud and Jodi Lyn O’Keefe.

results.title: The Crow: City of angels
results.creator_credit: Bad Bird Productions, Edward Pressman, Jeff Most and Tim Pope
results.brief_description: Sarah (Mia Kirshner), thought that Eric was the only one to be brought back from the dead to make the wrong things right. In this story from ‘The Crow’ anthology inspired by the character created by James O’Barr, a young father, Ashe (Vincent Perez) and his son are brutally murdered when they witness a gruesome killing. Ashe is brought back to life by the mysterious powers of the Crow, but is also aided by a human, Sarah, who knows about the crow legend. Ashe must seek vengeance on those who killed him so that his soul, and that of his son can be at peace. Also starring Iggy Pop, Richard Brooks and Thomas Jane.

results.title: The Crow road
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Union Pictures Productions, Bradley Adams and Calvin Miller
results.brief_description: Rory McHoan was last seen on his way to visit his brother, Kenneth, seven years ago. No trace of him was ever found despite an exhaustive police investigation. Inspired by his grandmother, Rory’s nephew, Prentice, takes on the task of finding Rory, and uncovering the truth about his missing uncle’s disappearance. With only Rory’s archaic and unreadable computer disks, pages of a novel-in-progress, and a ghost at his shoulders, Prentice must make a long journey with discoveries to be made about himself before he can unravel the dark secrets that lie buried in his family’s history. Based on a novel by Iain Banks. Cast includes: Joseph McFadden, Bill Paterson and Valerie Edmond.

results.title: The Crow
results.creator_credit: Crowvision, Edward Pressman, Jeff Most and Alex Proyas
results.brief_description: There is a legend that when a soul can’t rest, a crow can bring that soul back form the dead, to seek justice and make the wrongs thins right.. In the film which cost him his life, martial arts phenomenon Brandon Lee stars as a superhuman mystical hero who returns from the grave to exact revenge on the killers of his fiancee and himself. The film contains fantastic special effects, awesome action and a dark, cyberpunk setting. Lee was killed on the set accidentally in a manner similar to his father, martial arts legend Bruce Lee, so a stand-in was used to complete the filming.

results.title: The Crossing guard
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, David Shamroy Hamburger and Sean Penn
results.brief_description: Melancholy tale about a father who falls into alcoholism after his daughter is killed in a drink-driving accident. Estranged from his wife and fuelled by vengeance, Freddy awaits the release of the killer from jail, giving him three days to live. Stellar performances from Jack Nicholson and Anjelica Houston underpin this searing morality drama that tackles grief, guilt, and redemption. Also stars Robin Wright Penn and Piper Laurie.

results.title: The Crossing
results.creator_credit: WGBH (Boston), Zvi Dor-Ner and Daniel McCabe
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Columbus and the age of discovery”.
This episode takes us sailing in Columbus’ wake, a journey recreating his world to better understand our own. Travelling in the recreation of Columbus’ ships, the “Santa Maria”, the “Nina” and the “Pinta”, the modern crew duplicate the original preparations for the voyage in Palos de la Frontera in Spain, then follow Columbus’ route south to the Canary Islands (where he may have had a romantic interlude with the female governor!) and westward across the Atlantic. Although the ships, navigation and shipboard routines were all duplicated by the modern crew, they could not possibly recreate the anxiety suffered by the original crew sailing into the unknown, nor the relief experienced when land was finally sighted.

results.title: The Cross road crash
results.creator_credit: Telemark Productions, Film Australia and Commonwealth Department of Transport
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Indicates that crossroads are one of the most likely places to have a collision. Lists the type of crossroads and discusses the avoidance of situations leading to accidents. Suitable for upper secondary level.
